titles.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 37) proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States with respect to tax limitations.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 37.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-94, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 37 with 3 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. One motion to amend, if offered by the Minority Leader or his designee, shall be considered as read and shall be separately debatable for one hour equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 139.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/13/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.J. Res. 37 (constitutional amendment proposing tax limitations).
